Dialogue.NPCText:
A gentle woman in a gown of leaves tends to a group of children beneath an ancient tree. She hums softly, but her eyes dart to the sky at the sound of every bird.

She notices you and smiles, though her hands tremble as a sparrow chirps in the branches.

“Welcome, traveler. These little ones have seen much sorrow... and lately, something else. Their dreams have grown dark, haunted by a lady of shifting shadows. Will you help us bring them peace?”

Option.text: Tell me more about these dreams.
Who are you, Toma?
Are you alright? You seem uneasy.
Tell me about your life before the Verdant Tribes.
Perhaps another time.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Toma gives a soft laugh, her voice weary.

“I am no shaman nor warrior, only a caretaker of those left behind. I teach their stories, bind their wounds, and chase away fears as best I can.
Once, I dreamed of wings and sunlight, but now... I dream only of keeping these children safe. That is enough.”

Option.text: How can I help the children?
Why do birds trouble you?
Thank you for sharing.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Toma’s eyes flicker with anxiety.

“When I was but a girl, a great shadow swept through my dreams—a woman with wings black as night. Since then, even the gentlest bird unsettles me. The children’s dreams now echo my own old terror. I fear this is no simple nightmare.”

Option.text: Tell me about these dreams.
Is the shadow lady Minax?
Can the tribe’s shamans help?
I’ll be careful not to frighten you with birds.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Toma gestures to a circle of children, some shivering, others lost in silent play.

“Night after night, they dream the same dream—a clearing lit by moonlight, a ‘Shadow Lady’ calling them by name. She offers comfort, but all who answer her grow cold, distant, afraid of even the dawn.
The shamans sense foul magic. If only someone brave could enter their dreams and break her hold...”

Option.text: How could I enter their dreams?
Could this truly be Minax?
Why does she call to the children?
I will return later.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Toma’s voice drops to a fearful whisper.

“Some here dare not speak her name. But I remember the old tales: Minax, mistress of shadows, who walks between worlds and snatches the innocent from their beds.
If she is reaching through the dream-realm... we are all in grave danger.”

Option.text: I will help free the children.
Has anyone ever faced her in a dream before?
I need time to think.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Toma frowns, her hands tightening on a child’s shoulder.

“The children of the Verdant Tribes hold much spirit and innocence. Such purity is coveted by dark powers—they make tempting prey for a being like Minax. Perhaps she seeks to twist their dreams, and thus our future.”

Option.text: I will break her hold if I can.
Is there no other way?
I am not ready for this.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“Our shamans have tried to ward the children’s dreams, but the Shadow Lady’s magic slips past all charms. Only one who dares walk the spirit roads, unburdened by fear, might break through.
I believe you are strong enough. If you wish, I can prepare the ritual.”

Option.text: I am ready. Prepare the ritual.
What will the ritual require?
I must prepare myself first.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Toma produces a small bundle of herbs and a pale blue charm.

“You must carry Dream Willow and Spirit Sage. Burn them at midnight beside the sacred pool. This charm will guide your soul into the children’s dream-realm.
When you are ready, I will give you the bundle.”

Option.text: Give me the ritual herbs and charm.
Let me find what I need first.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Toma lays a gentle hand on your arm, pressing the bundle of Dream Willow and Spirit Sage into your palm. A faint shimmer runs along the blue charm.

“Take these. Burn them at the sacred pool when the moon is highest. You will be drawn into the dream—beware the Shadow Lady’s whispers. Rescue the children within, and our tribe will owe you much.”
Quest Started: The Dreaming Children

Option.text: I will do all I can.
Can you tell me more about the dream-realm?
If I return, how will I know the children are safe?

Dialogue.NPCText:
“The dream-realm is a place of memory and shadow—nothing there can truly kill you, but the wounds to your spirit may linger. Beware: the Shadow Lady may appear as friend or foe, and her words may wound more deeply than any blade.
Trust only those you knew in life, and seek the moonlit clearing. There, the children wait to be found.”

Option.text: Thank you. I will be careful.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Toma smiles, hope flickering in her tired eyes.

“If you succeed, the children will wake at dawn, free of fear. I will know by their laughter—and by the sunlight that no longer seems cold.”
She squeezes your hand. “May the ancestors walk with you, dreamer.”

Option.text: I will not fail them.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Toma runs to embrace the children as they laugh and play, joy restored.

“You have done what our greatest shamans could not. The children sleep peacefully now, and our tribe’s hope is renewed.
Please, accept this blessing as a token of our deepest gratitude.”

Option.text: Thank you, Toma. The tribe is stronger together.
It was my honor to help.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Toma’s expression softens, her eyes distant with memory.

“I was not always of the Verdant. I was born in Nujel’m, where silk and laughter covered deep loneliness. My father bartered spices; my mother danced in taverns. They loved fiercely—but died early.
I was... sold, once. Rescued by a wandering druid named Kaelor—yes, *our* Chieftain Kaelor. He said the forest had claimed me, and I chose to listen.”

Option.text: You were sold? That’s awful...
You and Kaelor have history, then?
Tell me more about Nujel’m.
How did you become a caretaker?
That’s a lot to carry. Thank you for sharing.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Toma gives a slow nod.

“Slavery still thrives where coin outweighs conscience. The man who bought me wanted an obedient apprentice. I gave him none. I fled into the wilds, half-dead—until Kaelor found me.”
Her eyes flash. “I do not pity my younger self. I *learned*—how to protect the small and silent. That is why I stay.”

Option.text: Your strength humbles me.
Kaelor truly saved you then.
And now you teach children safety...

Dialogue.NPCText:
“He was younger then. Quieter. But even in silence, his presence was like an oath.”

She looks away, wistful. “There was a time I wondered if... no. We were not meant for romance, only purpose. Kaelor guards the forest. I guard its future.”
She gives a sad smile. “We still speak without words.”

Option.text: There is beauty in that kind of bond.
Thank you for your honesty.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“Nujel’m is beautiful, but beneath the perfume lies poison. Masks worn for pleasure, smiles sharpened for profit.”

She sighs. “I remember gold-threaded curtains and jasmine oil, but none of it ever felt real. The forest was the first place that breathed back.”

Option.text: It sounds like you found your true home.
Did you miss it at first?

Dialogue.NPCText:
“I missed stories at night... the warmth of a fire in colored glass. But here, the stories *live*—in bark and spirit, not just books.”

She chuckles. “Now, I get perfume from crushed herbs, not merchants. A fair trade.”

Option.text: A fair trade indeed.
Option.action: SendMessage:You feel a deeper respect for Toma.

Option.text: Thank you for this glimpse of your past.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“After my rescue, I healed in silence. One day, a child asked me to tell a story... and I did. Another brought me a beetle with a broken leg—I made a splint from a reed.”

She smiles. “It was never a decision. The children chose me. And now, I choose them.”

Option.text: You are a gift to this tribe.
May your stories protect them as much as your care.
